interventions.name: Early Pipeline
interventions.short: Journalism organizations can increase DEI by changing how they run early pipeline opportunities, such as internships; widening their recruitment nets to reach new candidates; using inclusive language in job descriptions, and adopting inclusive hiring policies.
interventions.description: Historically, it’s been more difficult for people of color to score internships in the journalism industry, many of which are unpaid. But organizations and publications are making concentrated efforts to provide paid internships to candidates from diverse backgrounds.

interventions.name: New platforms

interventions.description: Often diverse populations are shut out from the first wave of innovation, and in some cases, people with fewer resources are likely to leapfrog over existing platforms and use new ones that have a lower barrier to entry.

interventions.description: Traditional formats and cadences for news have been standardized for mass audiences and don’t appeal to audiences who are more attuned to media that conveys authenticity, immediacy and personality.

examples.text: Code Switch is an example of existing platform, melding it and creating a new voice and constituency
Reveal has been experimenting with mixtures of subject matter, platform and storytelling mode like creating a comedy show around toxic waste, play around strawberries.
